definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Ancient civilizations saw dreams as portals for receiving wisdom from the gods.
sentences.chinese: 夢在古文明中被視爲是與上帝對話，獲取智慧的入口。

sentences.english: China and India are both countries with ancient civilization.
sentences.chinese: 中國和印度同爲世界四大古文明的發源地。

sentences.english: They have found a kindred spirit in the ancient Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 他們在中國古文明裏發現了親屬般的精神。

sentences.english: Ancient environmental evolution is a main factor to make the mysterious disappearance of San Xingdui.
sentences.chinese: 三星堆古文明的神祕消失，古環境演化應是重要原因。

sentences.english: The Scythian Pazyryk of the Altai Mountain region were another ancient culture which employed tattoos.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾泰山脈的斯基臺人也是有紋身的古文明。

sentences.english: Even if we only look at military, ancient China would still be one of the strongest ancient civilizations.
sentences.chinese: 即使只看軍隊，古中國仍然是最強大的古文明之一。

sentences.english: The Yellow River valley is one of the important birthplace of china's ancient civilization.
sentences.chinese: 黃河流域是中華古文明的重要發祥地之一。

sentences.english: But there is a darker side to gambling with which ancient civilisations were also well acquainted.
sentences.chinese: 但賭博有其陰暗面，這點古文明中就已意識到。

sentences.english: The archeologist discovered the remains of an ancient culture.
sentences.chinese: 考古學家發現了一處古文明遺址。

definition: the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
medieval/Middle Ages/Chinese middle antiquity, 3rd to 9th centuries, including Sui and Tang Dynasties/Middle (of a language, e.g. Middle English)/used/second-hand
ancient hominid species such as Homo erectus, Neanderthal man etc
god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
